article.headline: Nicholls St. 78, Louisiana-Monroe 65
article.story: THIBODAUX, La. (AP) -- Adonis Gray had 17 points and Ryan Bathie 16 as Nicholls State beat cold-shooting Louisiana-Monroe 78-65 on Tuesday. The 13-point difference at the end of the game was the same as that at halftime, 47-34. Afam Nweke grabbed a game-high nine rebounds for Louisiana-Monroe (4-5). The Warhawks were led by 17 points from Jordan Payne, 13 from Lance Brasher and 11 from Jonas Brown. Justin Payne had 13 points for the Colonels (3-7), and Michael Czepil 10. Dominic Friend led the team in rebounding, with seven. The Warhawks made only 20 of their 50 field goal attempts (40 percent), including 12 of 31 (38.7 percent) from 3-point range, while the Colonels made 26-49 (53.1 percent), including 8 of 17 (47.1) from 3-point range. They also outrebounded the Warhawks, 32-25, and made 18 of 21 free throws, compared to 13 of 19 for Louisiana-Monroe.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
